instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2015 A1502 820-4924 green light/orange light. no boot no power
threads.message:
Having a a1502 2015 model,820-4924.

got liquid spilled on q7310, replaced.

check ppbus_s5_HS_COMPUTING,shorted to ground. found that q7310 is bad, replaced, q7310 and q7311.

Everything looks ok, then connected to charger. ppbus_G3h normal around 12. ppbus_s5_HS_computing is present and close to PPBUS_G3H

pp3v3 s5 is present,3.3v.  don't see any other obvious spilled area.  really get stuck now, any advice would be apprecaited

threads.title: 2015 A1502 820-4924 green light/orange light. no boot no power
threads.message: Q7310 will have shorted and put 12V to the CPU, guess what......

threads.title: 2015 A1502 820-4924 green light/orange light. no boot no power
threads.message: shit ,every time for these a1502 boards man. the lowest success rate model ever for me
